p: Within a group analysis showed that the aqueous fraction of B. abyssinica treated groups produced a significant (P < 0.001) drop in the blood glucose level on the seventh and fourteenth days as compared to the baseline BGL. Similarly, GLC 5mg/kg significantly (P < 0.001) dropped the blood glucose level on the seventh and fourteenth days as compared to the baseline BGL. As revealed in Figure 1, repeated treatment by aqueous fraction of B. abyssinica at doses of 100mg/kg, 200mg/kg and 400mg/kg produced a higher reduction in fasting BGL at the 14th days, 33.29%, 38.59%, 52.71%, and 59.66%, respectively for AQF100, AQF200, AQF400, and GLC 5mg/kg ( Table 3).
